<?in=collector type=card in=toALLenemies in=damage>

embeds.title: Searched for ""
embeds.description:
1: colorless card **Headcrush** - 0.00
2: collector card **Heat Wave** - 0.00
3: collector card **Raging Call** - 0.00
4: collector card **Whirling Flame** - 0.00
5: collector card **Thorn Whip** - 0.00

messages.content: 9 :drakeclapping:
5 if you count only damage

I've been pretty happy with this card most of the time I've taken it. Collector does have very limited access to AOE, with whirling flame and thorn whip being your best options, but you can't really count on finding them due to their rarity. Raging Call can be used in a pinch, but it's very slow and difficult to keep the torchead alive. Collector really appreciates 0 cost cards, since they naturally draw 6 cards a turn, letting them have more output every turn is great. The ember is nice to have around as fodder for pyre, and the strength gain is handy, even if it is very small. Hand clog is far less of an issue now that you can pay to exhaust embers if you really need to.

Unfortunately, it's not a lot of AOE damage, you can't really use this to answer tri-slavers or reptomancer, but it does at least contribute and lower the threshold for those fights a bit. I don't think I would count this as more than 1/2 an AOE card because the damage is so low (sort of like thunderclap for ironclad). Really nice pickup in act 1 to both give a bit of scaling for the boss fight, and to have a 0 cost card to increase output when you are still on 3 energy. Pretty decent against all 3 act 1 elites, giving some AOE for sentries, being extra damage for nob, and helping to scale against lagavulin while it's sleeping. Less useful as the run goes on, where the low output will cost you more, but if you have decent card draw or enough pyre to burn the ember quickly, it still contributes well. Upgrade is above average, since it's +3 on an AOE card, potentially being a +6 or +9 in multi enemy fights. Great way to help proc your ninja/attack relics since it's 0 cost, and the strength also pairs nicely with other cheap attacks. Gives multiple cards to proc pen nib and 2/3 cards you need to proc orange pellets.
<Whirling flame> despite being a rarity up is plainly worse than this

Uncommon Attack / 2 :energy_collector: / The Collector / Downfall

messages.content: 12 for 2 is quite dishevelled when things like <cleave> and <dagger spray> exist

Common Attack / 1 :green_energy: / The Silent / Slay the Spire

Deal 4 (6) damage to ALL enemies twice.

messages.content: And the hologram effect isnt worth a whole energy on its own
Not to mention... its uncommon
Meanwhile heat wave is... a little bit powercreepy, but i do find it useful even without much pyre
So yeah this card is basically collectors only AoE cause thorn whip is a specific rare and finger is way too gimmicky

I remember campaigning for more expensive collector cards when you are mine went from 3 to 2 cost, and I think whirling flame ended up pretty good for it. More cards that reserve works on instead of just an energy mechanic
I would rather collector have weird clunky expensive cards so reserve is something you have to properly invest in, and whirling flame being aoe headbutt makes at least some sense at 2 cost
the more 2 and 3 costs on the character the better for their overall identity, IMO.
on heat wave, it's honestly a goodstuffsish card and it moves well into late game
just having a source of renewable cards for zero for pyre is decent enough to justify it at multiple points in the run
I think it's an interesting card because it's good at things collector is bad at, like aoe, renewable pyre target, cheap card.
so it kind of "shores up" bad areas.

Ehhh not really tbh. The aoe is pretty bad because you have to wait a while anyway (does bad into repto and darklings, and only one of 5 act 3 bosses have more than 1 target) so the aoe is negligible, and if you don't have much better options than <headcrush> which requires <tick> and <tock> then you've got some serious problems thab headcrush isn't solving.

messages.content: 6 energy for meh damage THREE turns later is horrid. Yes headcrush doesn't exhaust so you *could* use it as neow damage but collector doesn't really struggle too much against Neow.
Also that is at BEST 3 turns from now, you also aren't guaranteed to draw it turn 1 unless you have... what is it <green locus>?

Yeah headcrush just sucks, would be an acceptable tool if you could get it in act 2, as if you can brain it, that would be excellent for slavers and gremlin leader.
Unfortunately it's stuck in act 3.
and when compared to <type=card reptomancer> and <type=card nemesis> it's a horrible result from an act 3 elite.

messages.content: repto is just powercrept envenom
<envenom>

embeds.title: Envenom
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 2 (1) :green_energy: / The Silent / Slay the Spire

Whenever an Attack deals unblocked damage, apply 1 Poison :p_poison:.

messages.content: to be fair, envenom is one of those cards where powercreeping it not necessarily bad

I did get Tick from a Greenpyre Locus on the Sentries fight, and it essentially solved that fight once I survived turn 2. And it's decent against the act 4 heroes, since their hp is high enough to get your money's worth out of it and you can kill them all at/around the same time to avoid the negative effects of their on death bonuses.

Would I ever take it after the giant head fight? Ehh...very rarely if at all. But it's not completely useless.

Actually, they're both uncommons. Also, a cleaner comparison would be doom and gloom from defect (10 upgrade 14), and whirling flame actually has better numbers overall (though no dark orb, you get a headbutt effect instead). I think the value from whirling flame comes from both relative scarcity, and in hitting relevant thresholds. Collector has very little AOE, very little card manipulation, and 12 (16) gets over several important break points in AOE fights (mostly gremlins, small slimes, and lice, though the extra damage is helpful to solve any AOE fight faster). The card may not always feel good to take, but it often fills in relevant gaps for collectors toolkit that make it a valuable addition in many runs.
